item.title: Review This Code Please
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

459 expert:

when it says ‘)’ expected, that means you need a ) and when it says ‘;’ expected, you need a ;

Yes but not in this case o.o[quote=“LeScape Pk, post:11, topic:115733”]take the spaces between the + statement away, player+" not player+ " or player + "[/quote]

Fixed that but still 10 errors: [code]client.java:9467: ‘)’ expected
sendMessage(“You have successfully killed " deadPlaye
r+”!");
^
client.java:9467: not a statement
sendMessage(“You have successfully killed " deadPlaye
r+”!");

^
client.java:9467: ‘;’ expected
sendMessage(“You have successfully killed " deadPlaye
r+”!");

 ^

client.java:9469: ‘)’ expected
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName+" has just k
illed " deadPlayer+" with the command.");

   ^

client.java:9469: not a statement
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName+" has just k
illed " deadPlayer+" with the command.");

              ^

client.java:9469: ‘;’ expected
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName+" has just k
illed " deadPlayer+" with the command.");

                                   ^

client.java:9473: ‘)’ expected
sendMessage(“You have not successfully killed " deadP
layer+”!");
^
client.java:9473: not a statement
sendMessage(“You have not successfully killed " deadP
layer+”!");

 ^

client.java:9473: ‘;’ expected
sendMessage(“You have not successfully killed " deadP
layer+”!");

     ^

client.java:11501: illegal start of expression
public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
^
10 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Review This Code Please

@Nets8 wrote:

You don’t need to add a ) on that line 100%. Or any of those on any other lines.

item.title: Review This Code Please
item.dc:creator: @459_expert 459 expert
item.description:
@459_expert wrote:

for the first one, add a ) where ^ points to.
for the third one, add a ; where the ^ points to.
for the fourth one, add a ) where the ^ points to.
for the sixth one, add a ; where the ^ points to.
and so on, for where it says ‘*’ expected, where * is a ; or ) etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Review This Code Please
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

Well, I just made a ::kill playernamehere command and I seem to get errors with it. It looks fine to me. Here it is: if (command.startsWith("killuser") && (playerRights >= 2)) { String deadPlayerName = command.substring(10); int deadPlayerNameIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(deadPlayerName); } if(deadPlayerNameIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.currentHealth = 0; } if (p.currentHealth = 0) { sendMessage("You have successfully killed "deadPlayerName+"!"); p.sendMessage("You have been successfully killed by an administrator."); PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName+"has just killed"deadPlayer+" with the command."); } if (p.currentHealth >= 1) { sendMessage("You have not successfully killed "deadPlayerName+"!"); }

Please explain what’s wrong with it. Thank you…

Read full topic
